019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken;
022import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.Configuration;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.ApisApi;
026import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.CustomObjectsApi;
027import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIGroup;
028import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIResource;
029import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1GroupVersionForDiscovery;
030import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1Namespace;
031import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
032import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
033import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.dynamic.DynamicKubernetesApi;
034import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
035import java.io.IOException;
036import java.util.HashSet;
037import java.util.LinkedList;
038import java.util.List;
039import java.util.Map;
040import java.util.Set;
041import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
042import java.util.logging.Level;
043import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
044import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.VmDefChanged.Type;
046import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
047import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
048import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
049import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
050import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
051
052/**
053 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
054 */
055@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
056public class VmWatcher extends Component {
057
058    private ApiClient client;
059    private String managedNamespace = "qemu-vms";
060    private final Map<String, VmChannel> channels
061        = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
062
063    /**
064     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
065     *
066     * @param componentChannel the component channel
067     */
068    public VmWatcher(Channel componentChannel) {
069        super(componentChannel);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Handle the start event.
074     *
075     * @param event the event
076     * @throws IOException 
077     * @throws ApiException 
078     */
079    @Handler
080    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException, ApiException {
081        client = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient();
082        // Get all our API versions
083        var apis = new ApisApi(client).getAPIVersions();
084        var vmOpApiVersions = apis.getGroups().stream()
085            .filter(g -> g.getName().equals(VM_OP_GROUP)).findFirst()
086            .map(V1APIGroup::getVersions).stream().flatMap(l -> l.stream())
087            .map(V1GroupVersionForDiscovery::getVersion).toList();
088
089        // Remove left overs
090        var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
091        purge(coa, vmOpApiVersions);
092
093        // Start a watcher thread for each existing CRD version.
094        // The watcher will send us an "ADDED" for each existing VM.
095        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
096            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
097                .getResources().stream()
098                .filter(r -> Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
099                .findFirst()
100                .ifPresent(crd -> watchVmDefs(coa, crd, version));
101        }
102    }
103
104    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
105        "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
106    private void purge(CustomObjectsApi coa, List<String> vmOpApiVersions)
107            throws ApiException {
108        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
109        Set<String> known = new HashSet<>();
110        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
111            // Get all known CR instances.
112            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
113                .getResources().stream()
114                .filter(r -> Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
115                .findFirst()
116                .ifPresent(crd -> known.addAll(getKnown(crd, version)));
117        }
118
119        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
120        opts.setLabelSelector(
121            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=vmoperator,"
122                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=vmrunner");
123        for (String resource : List.of("apps/v1/statefulsets",
124            "v1/configmaps", "v1/secrets")) {
125            var resParts = new LinkedList<>(List.of(resource.split("/")));
126            var group = resParts.size() == 3 ? resParts.poll() : "";
127            var version = resParts.poll();
128            var plural = resParts.poll();
129            // Get resources, selected by label
130            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
131            var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(group, version, plural, client);
132            var listObj = api.list(managedNamespace, opts).getObject();
133            if (listObj == null) {
134                continue;
135            }
136            for (var obj : listObj.getItems()) {
137                String instance = obj.getMetadata().getLabels()
138                    .get("app.kubernetes.io/instance");
139                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
140                    var resName = obj.getMetadata().getName();
141                    var result = api.delete(managedNamespace, resName);
142                    if (!result.isSuccess()) {
143                        logger.warning(() -> "Cannot cleanup resource \""
144                            + resName + "\": " + result.toString());
145                    }
146                }
147            }
148        }
149    }
150
151    private Set<String> getKnown(V1APIResource crd, String version) {
152        Set<String> result = new HashSet<>();
153        var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(VM_OP_GROUP, version,
154            crd.getName(), client);
155        for (var item : api.list(managedNamespace).getObject().getItems()) {
156            if (!VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(item.getKind())) {
157                continue;
158            }
159            result.add(item.getMetadata().getName());
160        }
161        return result;
162    }
163
164    private void watchVmDefs(CustomObjectsApi coa, V1APIResource crd,
165            String version) {
166        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
167        var watcher = new Thread(() -> {
168            try {
169                // Watch sometimes terminates without apparent reason.
170                while (true) {
171                    var call = coa.listNamespacedCustomObjectCall(VM_OP_GROUP,
172                        version, managedNamespace, crd.getName(), null, false,
173                        null, null, null, null, null, null, null, true, null);
174                    try (Watch<V1Namespace> watch
175                        = Watch.createWatch(client, call,
176                            new TypeToken<Watch.Response<V1Namespace>>() {
177                            }.getType())) {
178                        for (Watch.Response<V1Namespace> item : watch) {
179                            handleVmDefinitionChange(crd, item);
180                        }
181                    } catch (IllegalStateException e) {
182                        logger.log(Level.FINE, e, () -> "Probem watching: "
183                            + e.getMessage());
184                    }
185                }
186            } catch (IOException | ApiException e) {
187                logger.log(Level.FINE, e, () -> "Probem watching: "
188                    + e.getMessage());
189            }
190            fire(new Stop());
191        });
192        watcher.setDaemon(true);
193        watcher.start();
194    }
195
196    private void handleVmDefinitionChange(V1APIResource vmsCrd,
197            Watch.Response<V1Namespace> item) {
198        V1ObjectMeta metadata = item.object.getMetadata();
199        VmChannel channel = channels.computeIfAbsent(metadata.getName(),
200            k -> new VmChannel(channel(), newEventPipeline(), client));
201        channel.pipeline().fire(new VmDefChanged(VmDefChanged.Type
202            .valueOf(item.type), vmsCrd, item.object), channel);
203    }
204
205    /**
206     * Remove VM channel when VM is deleted.
207     *
208     * @param event the event
209     * @param channel the channel
210     */
211    @Handler(priority = -10_000)
212    public void onVmDefChanged(VmDefChanged event, VmChannel channel) {
213        if (event.type() == Type.DELETED) {
214            channels.remove(event.object().getMetadata().getName());
215        }
216    }
217
218}
